metadata.Title: CVE-2020-14361 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Compliant (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
A flaw was found in X.Org Server before xorg-x11-server 1.20.9. An Integer underflow leading to heap-buffer overflow may lead to a privilege escalation vulnerability. The highest threat from this vulnerability is to data confidentiality and integrity as well as system availability.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-14361` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

xdmx - 2:1.19.6-1ubuntu4.5
xdmx-tools - 2:1.19.6-1ubuntu4.5
xmir - 2:1.19.6-1ubuntu4.5
xnest - 2:1.19.6-1ubuntu4.5
xorg-server-source - 2:1.19.6-1ubuntu4.5
xserver-common - 2:1.19.6-1ubuntu4.5
xserver-xephyr - 2:1.19.6-1ubuntu4.5
xserver-xorg-core - 2:1.19.6-1ubuntu4.5
xserver-xorg-legacy - 2:1.19.6-1ubuntu4.5
xserver-xorg-xmir - 2:1.19.6-1ubuntu4.5
xvfb - 2:1.19.6-1ubuntu4.5
xwayland - 2:1.19.6-1ubuntu4.5
No subscription required

xorg-server-source-hwe-18.04 - 2:1.20.8-2ubuntu2.2~18.04.2
xserver-xephyr-hwe-18.04 - 2:1.20.8-2ubuntu2.2~18.04.2
xserver-xorg-core-hwe-18.04 - 2:1.20.8-2ubuntu2.2~18.04.2
xserver-xorg-legacy-hwe-18.04 - 2:1.20.8-2ubuntu2.2~18.04.2
xwayland-hwe-18.04 - 2:1.20.8-2ubuntu2.2~18.04.2
No subscription required

notes.Note: mdeslaur> xorg server is actually the xorg-server package the xorg package only contains docs

criterions.comment: xorg-server package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2:1.19.6-1ubuntu4.5').
xorg-server-hwe-18.04 package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2:1.20.8-2ubuntu2.2~18.04.2').
